text:
500 ml bottle. BB 6/Juli. Thanks Timo A!
Clear golden color with a grayish white head.
Dry malty aroma.
The flavor is hops, mild bitterness, grainy malt, dryness and mild honey sweetness. 
Balanced. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

50 cl bottle @ Timo A. BBE 06.07.2017
Pours pale clear golden color with a head. Aroma is clove and grass, pale malts, subtle sweet starchy notes. Flavor is grain, clove, pale malts, faint hops, distant honey.
3314

50 cl bottle @ Timo A, BBE 06.07.2017
Aroma is musty with bush leaves and some honey-ish malt. Flavour has herbal tones, grassy hops, grainy malt and mild herbal tones. Refreshing and easy to drink. I wonder why this is in kellerbier category? More like a Dortmunder/Helles.

0.5 l bottle from P&M Getränke, best before June 2017. Clear, golden yellow with a medium large, frothy, almost stable, white head. Slightly sweetish, moderately grassy-spicy, slightly floral and a bit fruity aroma of fresh grass, cereals and slight hints of citrus. Sweetish, minimally bitter, moderately grassy-spicy and a little fruity taste of honeyish malts, straw, cereals and a touch of citrus, followed by a short, slightly bitter, moderately grassy-spicy finish. Medium body, smooth and slightly effervescent mouthfeel, soft carbonation. Highly quaffable, very pleasant to drink, could use a bit more hops maybe, then it would be even better.
Bottle care of Paul with simz and I, pours a very lightly hazy golden with large head. Nose of hops, grass, crisp malt, corn, and toast. Medium bodied. Really refreshing and crushable.

Bottle 0.5l at Bierproeflokaal In De Wildeman Amsterdam, The Netherlands. 22.03.2017. Thanks!!! Taste with kermis. Pour it clear golden color with small white head. Aroma light malt. Taste starts with cereal, nuts, easy drinkable, pinch of sweet fruity notes, smooth yeasty texture, really nice, medium body, slick feel, average carbonation, long finish.

A lot of bottles in Berlin, and on gravity keg in Berlin and Rome (tapped that day), and once at the brewery.

It is my favorite beer. I always go back to it. When it is fresh, it is just amazing. So drinkable. Great subtle hops, great mouthfeel, just want I want to drink all day.

Bottle at in de Wildeman. Near clear dark golden with a white head. Aroma of light malt, grain, biscuit and a touch of fruit. Flavour is light sweet and above light bitter. Light bodied with light carbonation.

Keg at Scurreria, Genova, Italy, Saturday 11th February 2017  Quite a sweet lager, so easy drinking, a light bitterness, touch of fruit, really easy drinking beer, really soft and smooth, very good.  A6 A4 T7 P4 Ov14 3.5

Keg @Cafe Abseits, Bamberg. 07-08-2016.
Pours little hazy golden with nice white head. Moderate head retention, some lacing. DMS, strsw nose. Light body, average carbonation, little crispy texture. Taste is sweet, malty, herbal.

0,5 l bottle 
light golden color, slightly hazy, frothy white foam head. 
bread, cereal, herbs, medium sweetness, lightly bitter (but remarkably bitter for a Lager), medium - soft carbonation. 
Very very nice Lagerbier.

50cl bottle. Semi-hazy orange pour with a thin white head. Notes of pilsner malts, light bitter-sweet fruit, bitter hops, raspberry jam. Medium to light body and carbonation and a light and refreshing finish.

Hazy golden color with white head. Aroma has honey malt and bread crust. Taste starts slightly sweet and bready, continues with a really clean malt profile and finishes more hoppy with a nice, earthy bitterness. Light to medium bodied, well carbonated. Overall this is a very tasty lager that showcases the solid malt backbone as well as the earthy hop character.
Yellow, medium head, aroma of apple, lemon, grainy, malt, fruity flavor, apple, bitter, lemony, grainy, malty, refreshing, medium bodied.
Bottle in Germany. Hazy yellow pour. Aroma of grains, crispy hops, some yeast and a hint of spices. Flavor is quite bitter, crispy hops and with a full body. Intense pilsener.

In bottiglia. Oro carico. Velata. Naso di crosta di pane e profumi erbacei. In bocca inizio maltato con finale amaro. Una delle migliori keller provate

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUN 15, 2017 Tap at Café Abseits. Hazy yellow color with frothy white head. Aroma is sweet grains, some yeast and some Fruchtgummi sweetness. Taste is more Fruchtgummi, bready-yeasty, bitter finish. Natural carbonation, soft oily mouthfeel. Franconian standard I suppose, really drinkable! 7-4-7-3-14
Tap at Café Abseits again. Much hoppier, fresher. While the one Ive had before was very good, this one is really stellar! 8-4-8-4-16

Normal white crown, hazy golden body. Floral hops n floral malts to the nose. Taste has mild floral soft hops, bready pale malts, honey notes - leading to a maltly finish with milk n apples. On palate ok, ok body. Ok overall too. This has been on Abseits now and then since 2004.

Tap @ Cafe Abseits. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of Citrus, grassy, light grains, formal with a mineral. Taste is rather bitter with loads of hops, grassy, light bread and some grains. Decent

L:
-pours a hazy golden-orange with a medium to big,foamy, white head
-high carbonation visible
S:
-spicy,bready,honey,dough,onions,appl orange,white grapes,orange zest,sweaty
T:
-bready,spicy,grassy,honey,apple, lemon,herbal,orange zest
-finishes dry
F:
-medium carbonation
-light to medium body
O:
Very good Kellerbier aside from the sweaty off-smell.Surprisingly light for a franconian Keller.

-medium,lingering bitterniss for the style

At a tasting, thanks, small stable creamy bubbly head, a touch hazy deepish yellow color, malty honey slightly woody aroma with perfumed hints, malty flavor with a medium empathic herbal bitterness, noticable but quite mellow bitterness. Nice and clean.

Bottle sample at a tasting at troubless place. Thanks Tom C. Hazy golden with lots of small floaties and a white head. Grainy and bready aroma, with fresh lager yeast, slightly citric. Flavor is slightly sweetish, with grains, bread, citric yeast, and nice herbal hops bitterness. Nice and easy-drinking.

Una lager magistrale. Nel bicchiere la birra é bionda con leggera schiuma bianca. Al naso sottile erbaceo. In bocca lamaro si fa strada equilibrato da sottili notte di pane e cereali. La birra é secca, pulita piacevole ma mai banale.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Lager pazzesca, in bottiglia e in fusto, bionda chiara morbida dal finale amaro il giusto
UPDATED: FEB 24, 2016 Tab Abseits, Bamberg. Süffiges, trübgoldenes Zwickel mit feiner Perlung und cremiger Schaumkrone. Aromen von Toffee, Biskuit, Getreide.
0,2l on tap @ Abseits Cafe. Pours clear golden with a medium head. Aroma is grainy malts. Flavor is sweet grainy malts with some hops. Not bad.
Im not in love with the german beer, but this, Ladies & Gentlemen, is a perfect lager!! There isnt any problem whit this, its only perfect.

Draft @ Café Abseits, Bamberg. Pours a hazy yellow color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty grassy hoppy aroma. Fruity malty grainy grassy hoppy flavor. Has a fruity malty grainy hoppy grassy finish.
Draught at Café Abseits, Bamber, Germany. Hazy amber, medium white head. Bready malt, herbal hops, some yeasty notes. Medium bodied, medium carbonation. Dry with medium bitterness.
On tap at Café Abseits. Malty and bready smell. Similart taste with a light grassy and herbal hop aroma. Low carbonation. Very easy to drink.

Dalla botte in birrificio.
Chiara con bella schiuma.
Morbida, miele, fieno erba sul finale amarognolo
Ottima

Lightly hazed golden beer with sturdy, pillowy froth after an "angry" pour. Smells like honeyed, corny grain with a bit of alcoholic heat there. Subtle bit of buttery diacetyl. Round, sweetish, honey-butter flavor rolls into a firm herbal bitterness, which lingers after on the tongue a bit. No shortage of character here. I dont know if it warrants the hype, but Ive found it very reliable.

Flasche (50 cl) von Hopfen & Malz, Berlin. - Helles Orangegelb, nur leicht trüb. - In der Nase Hefe, mildes Karamelmalz und nicht allzu kräftiger aber angenehm krautig-grasiger Hopfen. - Antrunk mild hefig, schwach karamellig und gut hopfenherb mit Gras und bitterer Orangenschale. Nur schwach malzsüß, was den Hopfen noch besser zur Geltung bringt. Mild rezent, etwas mineralisch, recht trocken im Mund und gerade dadurch sehr süffig. Schön herber Abgang; anhaltend bitterer Nachtrunk. - Sehr angenehmes, schön herb-trockenes Kellerbier.

500 ml bottle from Les Vignerons. Light gold, perfectly clear, with a big, fluffy and persistent white head. On the nose dough/white bread, tons of herbal and freshly cut grass notes, slightly nutty, a hint of wet tea leaves as well. Lovely rich malty taste, clean and lingering togheter with a earthy and slightly spicy bitterness. Zingy mouthfeel, excellent drinkability. Average to lively carbonation, medium body, creamy texture. Very, very nice.

Al naso, come al palato, crosta di pane e cereali; sul finale una nota amaricante.
Corpo medio-leggero, molto beverina.
Colore dorato, leggermente velata dai lieviti in sospensione.
Buona persistenza della schiuma.
Tutto sommato è piacevole.

Tap at Abseits. Nose of white toasted bread, a bit buttered, maybe. Cloudy gold, dark, with a high, fine head. Sweet, a bit buttery, stone fruit esters, peach, orange. Good, but not quite great. Bit too sweet and too much diacetyl. The latter isnt enough to ruin the beer, but enough to knock it down quite a bit.

On tap at Bir&Fud Rome-Italy. Pours such a bright golden color, semi-filtered appearance with a huge white clean cap. Nose: peculiar Franconia yeast feel, hay and maltiness. Mouth: WOW! All low-fermentation beers should be like this one. Bread crust, milled pilsner malts, dry end and such a peculiar feel to chew liquid bread. Thank you Manuele!
Leicht trübes goldgelbes Bier mit einer schönen weißen Schaumkrone. Geruch malzig, grasig, floral. Geschmack süß malzig, Getreide, mild hopfig.
Many thanks for this bottle to Beerhunter111. Pale gold with a thin head, good lacing. Aroma is grain, malt and fruity hops. Flavour is malt, grain and straw

50cl screwtop bb03/2015, catered by Daniel, merci. Radiantly fresh example of an unspectacular style taken for granted outside of Franconias confines: the contained grassiness and earthy grain in aroma do not betray the wealth of subtle, dry, citrus goodness beneath: generously hopped with probably whole cone Hallertau at its best, very crisp and lean in biscuit malt body, dry ending. Excellent aperitif and thirst quencher.

Cosa posso dire.....perfetta! una vera lager fresca tedesca molto molto beverina colore dorato con schiuma consistente. Al naso cereali, crosta di pane ed erbacea. In bocca molto ben equilibrata con leggera amarezza. Il corpo è medio leggero ed il sapore riporta note di malto e luppolo. Bevuta in fustino a caduta nella Birroteca Vaffalluppolo a Fermo.
Tap @ Cafe Abseits, Bamberg, 14/11/14. Pours a hazy dark yellow with a medium, white head. Aroma is fairly grainy. Taste is a lot of grain, light yeast, some grass, fairly basic graininess. Light.

First pour from the newly tapped gravity barrel at the brewery, Aug. 2014: Lightly hazed yellow. Creamy halo of lathery foam adorns the glass. Sophisticated nose of rich baguette, lemon, nectar, peach, herbs, minerals and potent sulfur. Fluffy and soft on the tongue. Initial surge of sharp minerals is enhanced by rustic sulfur chased by a softening push of lush and edgeless baguette pils malt and soothing hop oils. Fresh-picked hop pungency mirrors that of the sassy sulfur and mineralic vivacity. Pervasive yeasty rusticity vivifies the adeptly extracted haylike malt. Tongue-smacking, saliva-inducing hop succulence is well matched against the cracker dough and hay dust starches. Forceful punch of lemon zest and peppery hop bitterness is tempered by a splash of vibrant nectar in the luxuriously clean finish. Stefan might be a one-dimensional brewer (all five lagers in his portfolio are golden and centered around Hallertau and pils maltfine by me, since well-attenuated golden lagers speak the language of my heart), but the fact that he is churning out some of the cleanest beer in Franconia testifies to his masterful brewing skills. (4 / 8 / 4 / 8 = 4.0)


CO2 keg at Cafe Abseits in Bamberg, Aug 2014: Pale clear golden. Uneven collar of wispy foam. Clean but restrained aromas of lemon, minerals, baguette, vibrant peach and a hint of sulfur. Prickly and foamy carbonation. High in carbonic acid. Firm body. Lemony hop twang yields to a snappy pils-derived tastiness and bracing minerals. Rich and refined malt is matched by polished hop nectar and tongue-coating oils, which soften the mineralic onslaught. Hint of peachy esters sneaks in, as well. Dry finish is lined with lemony hop acids and flower nectar as well as fresh baguette and and honey-kissed hay. A respectable rendition, but completely forgettable when compared to the barrel pours fresh from the brewery. So much of the beers soul has been compromised by the ramped up gas levels in this keg pour, and consequently its quite flimsy and sour in the mouth. The bottle also fares similarly average. (4 / 7 / 3 / 7 = 3.2)
user_location: Blue Ridge Mountains, North Carolina, USA

text: Fra fat på Cafe Abseits, Bamberg 9 Okt 14. Gyldenbrun. Veldig lavt skum. Forsiktig fruktaroma. Smaken er malt med en svakt syrlig fruktig ettersmak. Bierprobe.

200ml bierprobe vom Fass at Cafe Abseits. Remaining low white layer to an unclear golden coloured body. Aroma of pale malts, lightly spiced. Mid-sweet malty flavours, hints of caramel, with drying noble hops to the ending. Medium bodied. Soft in the mouth. Decent lager (Bamberg 09.10.2014).

Gravity pour at the brewery. Huge authentic grainy, almost funky, and earthy aroma. Taste is rich grain, earthy and moderatly bitter from the hops. Light bodied and low carbonation. It is a little dirty to be among the very best, but still in the top tier. Very impressed by my first lagerbier.
Draft sample at the oktoberfeast in the south street seaport. Malty foamy interesting tasting lager
From tap at Cafe Abseits, Bamberg. Light hazy, golden color with white head. Aroma is malty grainy, straw and light grassy hoppy. Taste is light sweet and bitter. Light body, oily, soft carbonation.
On draft at Snallygaster 2014 in D.C. Pours a clear gold with a white head. Aroma of biscuit and lemon. Flavors of white bread and citrus. Smooth, crisp finish.

Rubber clad gravity keg pour at Snallygaster 2014. I know that this is a special beer that only comes out once a year, but it just wasnt for me. There was absolutely no aroma. Flavor was muted and understated, tasted of a typical traditional german wheat beer. Just not my thing.

draft at Café Abseits in Bamberg, November 2011. cloudy hazed gold body with a fine white head. crisp and light noble hop nose with light a touch of wheat. mild sweetness, a bit thin, but quenching with medium acid, though a bit too much of apple juice character and brings a slight twang into play.
6/4/6/4/12, 3.2

From gravity barrel at the brewery in Monscahmbach, August 2014. Hazed gold with a lasting fine white head.
Rich aroma showing well the spice and lemon character of German hops, with added mineral / sulfur effect from the yeast.Medium light body, semi-sweet, hoppy and oily with well-balanced bitterness. Sulfuric and lemon-y, similar in character to Griess Kellerbier, though maybe not as deep and layered. Still, its well-made, well-balanced, flavorful, hoppy, lightly acidic, mineral-rich, juicy and oily. 
8/5/8/4/17, 4.2
Pours slightly cloudy yellow with a decent head. Fresh hop aroma. Refreshing, clear flavour with a hint of bread. Very nice lager.

Gravity pour at the brewery. Very grainy aroma, very grassy, nice kellerbier farmy funk aroma, fresh cut hay, light lemon notes. Taste is fresh, grainy, yeasty, light flavor, very easy drinking. Palate is light bodied, silky smooth with just a hint of carbonation. Yum.
Alla spina al whynot Alassio, note erbacee, grande beva, la birra da bere tutti i giorni dellanno. eccezionale.

Tap at why not ,alassio, Italy .. Golden in color a bit cloudy because unfiltered .. Oil ,herbs ,grain are predominant with a great balance between hopping and smoothness .. For sure one of the best easy drinking lager in the world !!

Bamberg jolly day 2 25/01/2014. Draft at Cafe Abseits. Aroma is nice mineral, wet grass, silage. nutural grain, grainstore. Flavour is grainy, grassy nobel hop. Hazedgolden yellow, fleeting white head. Medium grainy palate. Some sweet cornflakes. Good stuff.
Una delle più buone lager tedesche, con un gusto discretamente ricco, caratterizzato dalle note floreali del luppolo, malto, con una sfumatura di buccia di limone e un tocco amaro leggero.
Tap @ Lambiczoon, Milano. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are rich malt, grass, straw and hops. Nice and oily palate.

25th January 2014Bamberg Bash Day 2. Cafe Abseits. Draft thanks to Gerhard. Hazy gold beer, small white head. Palate is smooth with good minerally carbonation. Smooth pale malt but then a carbonated bite. Light malt cream. Light floral bitterness. Smooth finish with a mild bitter linger. Clean and tasty.

How: Draught.
Where: Café Abseits, courtesy of Gerhard.
Appearance: Hazy golden colour with a white head.
Aroma: Bitter hops, citrus, caramel, sweet malt.
Body: Medium body and mild carbonation.
Flavour: Slightly metallic, sweet malt, citrus, caramel.

Day 2 of the post Xmas Bamberg Jolly, tap at Cafe Abseits, NOT SHARED !!!, big thanks to Gerhard for the pour, 25/01/14.
Lightly hazed golden with a good sized off white head.
Nose is pale malts, citrus, bread dough, clean and fresh aromas.
Taste comprises bread dough, straw, lemon rind, clean, grass, citric notes, light caramel wash.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, clean closure.
Nice stuff, easy drinking.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle 0.5l. Pours almost clear golden with small white head. Aroma has malt, grass, cereal. Taste is light sweet, medium bitter, hops, grass. Aftertaste has a good bitterness with some sweetness. Perfect crisp session beer.

This beer is amazing, like, totally amazing. Slight bready aroma, pours out with a mere hint of haze in spite of the declaration of "naturtrüb" on the bottle (most naturtrüb stuff in Germany is as cloudy as a Berlin winter). Looks pretty ordinary in the glass. Tastes amazing, incredible carbonation and palate, fizzier than normal lagers but also slightly creamy in an indescribably good way. Fantastic bitterness. I would drink this every day and twice on Sundays.

Gravity keg at Maxs. Pours lightly hazy gold with a small, fizzy white head, short retention with light lacing. Aroma is Pils malt, earthy hops and meal/cereal notes. Flavor is malt dominant with light hops and bitterness and a dry finish. Medium to light body and medium carbonation.
Ontap at Cafe Abseits. Hazy golden with a small white head. Malty aroma with herbal and grassy hops, and a fruity hint. Dry, herbal and grassy flavour with a good bitter finish
lovely easy drinking session beer, some haze and a nice malt/hop balanced profile, finishes well.

06/07/2013 Ma che siete venuti a fà (tap). Dorata intensa, limpida, schiuma bianca abbondante e discretamente persistente. Al naso leggera punta di zolfo, lieviti, malto, pane, note erbacee. In bocca è morbida, gustosa, malto, pane, finale amaro e secco. Corpo leggero, carbonazione media. Ottima, di grande beva e buona sostanza.

On tap at Cafe Abseits, Bamberg.Pours hazy golden with a small white head. Aroma is grassy hops and grain. Taste is light sweet grainy,delicious fresh with lots og grassy and citrussy hop at the final, a very good first beer in Bamberg.
Draught at Akkurat, Stockholm. Clear golden beer with a medium offwhite head. Hoppy and fruity aroma. Similar flavour. A nice refreshing beer :-)
Draught at Cafe Abseits, Bamberg, Germany. A hazy golden coloured pour with a medium white head on top. Hoppy, malty aroma. Tastes malty, hoppy, slightly sweet. Very nice.
On tap at Café Abseits, Bamberg.  Hazy gold beer. Some light toffee aroma, some hop.  Very full, some butter and toffee, some hop on en.  Not too gassy.  Decent malty full beer.  Tasty.

Draught at Akkurat, Stockholm. Clear yellow/pale golden beer with a nice lasting white head. Bready spicy aroma, citrus, grapes, wheat notes, caramel, biscuits, grassy hops. Hoppy citrus flavor, bready, biscuits, hay, caramel, spicy bitterness. Nicely balanced with a good hop and bread finish.
Kan nog vara en av de bästa lager jag snubblat på någonsin. Ren och len. Lättdrucken och perfekt för lite lagervandalism
This is how a zwickel should be. Golden, white persistent head. cripsy, malty, fresh, a bit zesty. Dry malty long finish.

On tap @ Cafe Abseits. Pours a slightly hazy honey color with a nice off white head. Smell is earthy, floral with mild malt aromas. Taste is a wonderful balance of light malt and crisp hops - ends dry & floral with mild sweetness. Light/medium body with mild carbonation and a little slick. This was a real treat.

Oh hell yeah.  Tap at deep ellum out of one of those small aecht schlekerla lookin gravity kegs.   Beautiful crisp clean toasted nutty dough.  Juicy Fresh grass.  Fog. Goes down real nice.  Now this is a lager.  Fuck barrel aged barley wines.
Draft at brewery, wonderfully made lager. Very bitter for Germany, well balanced flavor of floral hops, touch of sweet maltiness for balance. An amazing all day beer
Leggermente dorata buona schiuma piuttosto persistente leggetmente maktata unvticco floreale erbaceo buoanxiata buona beva media secchezza

Igazi meglepetés volt ez a sör. Nem a kinézete, mert az olyan, mint a többinek, viszont az illata és az íze rendkívüli ebben a családban. Az egész rendkívül gyümölcsös, körtés, szőlős, illatos, élesztős, kicsit búzamalátás, selyemcukros és igen komlógyantás. Közepesen testes és alig szénsavas. Utóíze keserédes és igen gyümölcsös. Úgy csúszik, mint bolond pingvin a jégen és finom.

20/VII/2012 - 50cl bottle @ home - BB: 18/VII/12 - (2012-732) Thanks to Pepijn for sharing the bottle!
Clear blond beer, white irregular head, unstable, non adhesive. Aroma: little fruity, peaches, some citrus, bit grassy. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: little sweet in the start, malty, citrus, grassy bitterness, somewhat bready. Aftertaste: pretty bitter, citrus, little sweet, malty, nice dry ending.
Draught @ Cafe Abseits. Pours golden with a small white head. Very "natural" with sweet honey notes and flowery and herbal hops. Small and short lasting herbal bitterness.

UPDATED: AUG 6, 2015 Draught (Akkurat, Stockholm) - Hazy gold/amber with a foamy head. Bread, yeast, malt and hops in the aroma. Hoppy and bready taste with notes of dried fruit, malt and grain. 3.4 (2012)

Draught (Cafe Abseits, Bamberg) - Golden with a white head. Bread, elderflower and marmalade in the aroma. Elderflower, lemon, orange and yeast feature in the taste.

Bottle Hazy yellow lager with a large, wispy, white head. Fantastic retention. The aroma is a little skunky, but otherwise its bready and yeasty with spicy, funky hops. Medium-bodied and lightly creamy with soft carbonation. The flavor is generously bittered and mildly bready. Finishes crisp and lightly bitter. Very easy drinking. Thanks go out to erlangernick for his generosity!

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2012 Ungespundet at Akkurat Stockholm. High andfluffy white head over a light golden but clowdy beer. Perfectly clean pilsner malt taste with a firm and lasting bitterness. This is as god lager as there is malt and hops in a perfect mix that you could driink lots of and still want more. Perhaps served a litle too cold in the middle of the winter.

Had on Gravity CASK! .. @ Avenue Pub, NOLA .. . Pours a medium yellow gold .. . light headring .. light bitterness .. . slick and refreshing .. . . Caution: Anal intercourse may lead to irregular heart rhythms. Yeah, you know Im never gonna have to worry about that. Because God gave me a second lease on life and Im not gonna press my luck and take it up the ass.

On tap at CK for the gravity keg event. Cloudy orange, beautiful head. Very bready with rye and biscuit on the nose and tongue; flavor holds more dough and light fruit than the aroma. Smooth mouthfeel. Very nice.

Hazy straw pour with a nice white head. Doughy and bready,  with caramel, toffee, and grassy hops all making a showing in the aroma. The flavor is much the same, also having huge lemon and toasty biscuit notes. Mildly astringent palate with low carbonation and a clean finish.

Gravity cask.  Soft off-white head, nice lacing, crystal clear apple juice body.  Aroma is medium sweet, mild, some bread, light herb.  Taste is moderately sweet, hay, bread, apricot, spicy.  Soft light-medium body, light effervescence.

A hazed blonde Kellerbier with no head. In aroma, sweet chalky honey malt with light steeped tea. In mouth, a smooth sweet chalky malt with notes of honey, German hops, smooth. Gravity cask at Lord Hobo, Sept. 11 2011.
From tap at Cafe Abseits. Pours cloudy yellow with a huge, rocky and wite head. Aroma is mild grassy and light malty. Bitter, grassy and slight cornish. Bitter and dry finish.

Herber Antrunk, das Aroma steht anfangs alleine da und wird später durch eine dezente Hopfigkeit ergänzt. Bitterer werdend, stimmig, mit der Zeit würziger. Prägend ist weiter die vollmundige Bitterkeit.

Poured from a gravity cask at Churchkey during an event yesterday.

Pours a cloudy light yellow color with a pretty good-sized white head and nearly all-encompassing lacing as it went down. Nose brought good scents of light grain, hints of lemon citrus, and a bit of bread dough. The taste adds in some light fruity notes. Altogether, everything melds together quite well and while the flavors are very delicate, they are quite tasty. Feel is light with good carbonation; super crisp.

Drinkability was incredible. Prior to this, I hadnt had much experience with the style, so I thought I might have been overrating this at first. However, after quite a few other pours from different casks, it became clear that this was the best of the bunch and a great, great beer in its own right.

Serving type: cask

Reviewed on: 10-13-2010
Gravity cask at Churchkey.  Light in color, light in body, and a bit light in flavor as well.  Very plain stuff.
Lho assaggiata dal bicchiere di Sergio, direi una bella lager tedesca molto corretta, non molto amara.
Draught at the brewpub. Hazy golden colour. Small stable white head. The flavour starts off with a good clean bitterness. Good fruity flavour. Nice aroma hops. Very clean.

UPDATED: JUN 13, 2016 Draught @ Brewery. Pours clear dark golden with a small white head and lacings. Grainy and very grassy. Crisp and very smooth and hoppy flavor. Very nice. Re-Rate July -15. Gravity @ Brewery. 
Soft, smooth, juicy hoppy and delicious. 3,6-4,0. june -16. Another gravity pour. Soft, juicy and grassy! Probably the Best beer ive had this far. 15400 ratings.

Its hazy, warm golden with a huge, creamy, white head. The aroma has notes of malt, grain and flower. The flavour has a light sweetness and notes of malt, grain, flower, light butterscotch and straw. Its incredibly soft and nice.
UPDATED: SEP 8, 2010 Clear golden with a medium white head. Malty aroma with hints of caramel and hops. Flavour had malt, grassy hops, malt and hints of caramel. Finished dry and bitter.

Cask at Brooklyn dba: Nice hazy effervescent golden with a dense white head that retains well. Nice clean German lager aroma- doughy, biscuity substantial Munich malts. Crisp mouthfeel with a very dry and clean flavor. Bready and biscuity Munich malts balanced by a spicy hop presence that dries out the long finish. A very easy going session.

Gravity cask at Redlight Redlight.  Pours a mostly clear, medium golden hue with a small, fading head of smooth, off-white foam.  Minimal, wet spotting marks the glass.  The aroma is ultra-clean and bready, showing notes of light toast, dough, and creamy pils malt in the background.  Surprisingly hoppy, with notes of peppery flowers and fresh grass, the balance is superb.  Flavors show the same, excellently balanced between a creamy, doughy, pils malt profile and biting grassy hop bitterness.  Medium bodied and balanced as can be, the palate is simply smooth as silk.  This stuff is sessionable for hours on end, yet each sip remains completely satisfying.  Good stuff.  Reason #1,247 why I need to go spend some time in Germany.

gravity cask @ redlight redlight.  Malty nose, sweet with grassy notes.  Pours pretty clear with a slight haze, golden blonde with a creamy thick white head.  Malty with some light fruit notes, with grassy hops, not very complex but extremely drinkable!
Gravity cask at Redlight. Golden color.  White head.  Grain and euro-hops in the nose.  Soft but crisp flavor.  Very good for the style. I could drink it all day.

Gravity cask at redlight redlight.  This is a very light golden lager.  It isnt all that complex but it is very refreshing especially in Florida where it is late October and still 90+ degrees outside.  Seriously, I hate the weather here.
tapped at City Beer. Nice cloudy yellow color with a quickly dissipating head. Grainy notes, with apple flavors, and some hrbs and bitter hops in the finish. Nice.

Ceramic mug.  Rich herbal aroma is spicy with complex malt toastiness and fresh hop.  Farmhouse...rustic character with minerals, earth and dry herbal hopping.  Quality and balance.  Delicious example.  Re-samples at Tapas Bar have backed this up.

Draft, in Krug, nice thin but tight white head. Nice light golden color. Smells very fresh of grain, sweet and husky. Low carbonation. Flavors are smooth, husky, dry, woody, cedar, apple, apple skin, and good metals.

Bayerische [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, Stockholm. Golden colour, small white head. Aroma is hops, earth, some bittery notes, diacetyl and mild notes of yeast. Flavour is hops, grass, malts and some slight yeasty notes.

(draught, at Café Abseits, Bamberg) pours a lightly hazy deep golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of buttered pale malts, honey, light floral hops and some characteristic diacetyl. flavour is the same, with lots of grain and light herbal hoppy qualities. medium body with smooth carbonation and a light bitter finish.

Sampled draught at Akkurat, Stockholm. Pours out in a hazy dark golden colour with a rich and rocky white foam. Fresh and really crisp and aromatic aroma of elegant mellow grassy hops, white bread, biscuits and minerals. Medium-bodied with notes of white bread, fresh grassy hops, nuts and minerals. Long aromatic and fresh grassy aftertaste.

UPDATED: JUN 28, 2011 2011-02-13, draught at Café Abseits, Bamberg, 7-3-6-3-13=32Cloudy blond color; creamy head. Delicate but nice malt aroma. Smooth mouthfeel, sweetish malt flavor, with decent hopping. In good conditions and refreshing.2009-02-12, Bayerische Anstich at Akkurat, Stockholm, 8-4-7-5-16=40Hazy blond color; big head. Wonderful aroma of hops and malt, pure Pilsener. Excellent malt flavor and good hopping, but less impressive than the aroma, light traces of herbal hops, missing the ending freshness and kick that I find sometimes in my reference Pilsner (Tipopils). Excellent!

Bottle at Spuyten Duyvil. Dickinsonbeer loves this stuff. Beautiful head. Extremely clean and crisp, with squash and German hops. Extremely easy drinking, a mild vegetalness in the malts complements the very fresh hop finish. Awesome.

Bottle at Spuyten Duyvil - I had many german beers at this Spuyten event, and it became very clear to me that the better a german beer is, the more ineffable its greatness is - this is the case here - it is superbly balanced, and incredibly smooth, yet crisp - a lot of grassy bitterness tempered by perfect, balancing sweet malt complexities that never burden the tongue - so amazingly flavorful, yet easy to drink - I want to drink this all day, every day - I totally realize that this rating is incredibly uninformative, but I don’t even care - my notes pretty much say that it is indescribably good - it stood out on a day where we had a lot of stand out german lagers - that says a lot

Café Abseits, Bamberg.

Head is mostly diminishing.
Body is light to medium yellow.

Aroma is lightly malty (toasted grain), lightly hoppy (flowers, herbs).

Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly bitter.
Finish is lightly sweet, moderately bitter.

Light to medium body, watery/velvety texture, lively carbonation.

Nothing special...light and uninteresting.

(bottle) Hazy, pale golden colour with a big blond foamy head. Light-sweet malty aroma, moderately yeasty, subtle fruity (pears, pine apples) with spicy herbal hops. Bitter flavour with light sweet edges, well-carbonated, fresh mouthfeel. Yeasty, slightly fruity taste on a soft malty base with herbal notes; dry and moderately bitter spicy and herbal finish with a yeasty and hoppy bitterness and a balancing malty sweetness. A somewhat rural but also very rounded and pleasant brew.

UPDATED: AUG 15, 2007 Immense is not even an adequate descriptor for the sheer complexity found within. Astonishing would be an understatement for the surprising appearance, just loaded with an inch of sedimentary proteins at the bottom; large coagulated masses that give this the single most startling appearance, while still in the bottle, that Ive ever encountered. This is a simple unfiltered lager, right? Hardly. A slow pour leaves giant particulates behind, so what flows into the glass is a totally translucent, sparkling golden body with unkempt brassy hues. A thick, cloth-like white head adorns the top for most of the quaff, leaving behind sultry lacing in wide swaths as the glass drains. The nose is so elegant, an ultimately relaxing aromatic wave. Fresh grassy hops, also a touch fruity, lead in the aroma. Light notes of hay, ground cereal grains and strawberry fields follow. The yeast profile, though quite faint, is pristine and as fresh feeling as it typically seems on brew day. Overall the nose is very soft but expresses itself wonderfully and begs another long, contemplative inhalation. The flavor has a crispness and a resounding clarity I long for in a German Kellerbier. Bready notes take center stage and wage quiet battle with sweet caramel for the remainder of the taste for the dim spotlight. Sipping this, or gulping(as Im inclined to do, its absurdly drinkable), is a variational experience of sitting alone in the dark, captivated by a new experience thats both velvety and sublime. Graininess hinted at in the aroma is more profound here and in the finish, but never cumbersome, only a gentle comb though this oasis of grass. Herb notes join the hop-filled sprinkles that explode across the tongue, dispersing evenly and providing just enough bitterness to scatter a subtly coalescing sweetness. Acidic forays are nowhere to be found, this is unadulterated silkiness. The carbonation is wound up so tightly it could never be mistaken for anything but a natural occurence. The body is light-medium, fuller than beers that have typified the style for me in the past. Its uncompromisingly smooth, from the first tingle in the nose to the last drop that glides effortlessly down the back of the throat. The finish is glorified by what can only be a mineral composition in the brewing water that is the pinnacle of perfection, at least perfectly suited for this style of brewing, with these specific ingredients. A long and embracing finale leaves lush grassy notes and soft fruits behind, then its just a clean feeling that lingers on. A truly marvelous creation. There are better Kellerbiers in Franconia, but they are certainly far between and not found in this hemisphere. I could enjoy this every day, if only it were here for the taking.

On tap at Cafe Abseits, Bamberg, November 2006. Brilliant clear gold colour with a moderate white head. Aroma of hay and grassy hops. It was a bit grainy in the mouth, with some malt sweetness and a grassy hop finish. Excellent.

On tap, at the brewery-garden: Lacing, small white foamy layer; sweetish-grainy nose, underpinned by barnyardy aromas, a very faint hoppiness in the backyard; moderate bitter-sweet flavour, light-bodied, very smooth MF; soft bitter-sweet-fruity (bananas !) finish. A very well quaffable franconian Landbier...........

Bottle: Pale golden, visible sediment, light carbonation, moderate sudsy white head, dies quickly, light lacing. &nbsp Grass and hay on the nose, straw as well. &nbsp Very pale malts. &nbsp Quite grassy on the tongue, slight zip to it even. &nbsp Very mild hop presense, with a soft malt bed. &nbsp Slight cereal, but more in the whole grain sorta way. &nbsp Decent body, moderate mouthfeel. &nbsp Finish has a little twang to it, otherwise fairly clean. &nbsp Light overall, somewhat dry, pleasant, but a bit too barnish compared to others.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Fairly grassy and bitter. Typical clean German thing going on, with some light bready malt and grassy, lightly fruity hops. Perhaps a bit thin.

UPDATED: MAR 5, 2007 Summer 2006 bottle consumed on 2/27/07Holy Christ, to think I almost missed this beers brief appearance in the States.  Thankfully Kai at the Wine Gallery pointed it out to me and I remembered it was supposed to be interesting.Well interesting is certainly an understatement.  The nose is the epitome of a crisp, dry, refreshing lager.  Beautifully extracted/attenuated pils malts in the nose provide dry honey and barley notes.  Very light nutty biscuits and then a strong shot of dry, zesty hops that hint at a little fruitiness and lots of fresh grass.  But what really seals the deal is the yeast signature on the end.  Light, fluffy and wonderfully biting/crisp, its every bit as refreshing as the best Czech pils.The appearance is as fresh as if it was poured from the tank;  bountiful, perfectly retained white head atop a sparklingly clear, gold-brass body.  Lots of protein break on the bottom, but it remains behind in the pour.  Tiny, naturally carbonated bubbles rise in the liquid.  Plenty of lacing cascades down the glass.Again, what hits you in the flavor is that same startingly clear, fresh crispness.  The combo of crisp, dry, flavorful hop, crisp, clean, zesty yeast and dry, flavorful, grainy malt is almost too much to take in.  For all of the crispness/dryness, however, it still maintains an ever-so-slight chewy-sweetness of rich honey, that helps prevent things from getting over-dried.  Incredibly tight, engaging carbonation just tingles softly on the tongue, giving a perfect mouthfeel.  Wow.  An elegant yeast, clean, fresh water and fabulous aroma/flavor hopping, not to mention the charming, rustic malts, make for one hell of a beer.  Tough to decide between this and Emersons Pils.  On one hand, Emersons is much hoppier, a little more chewy in texture and probably more a robust beer.  This is a bit more sessionable and has a bit more grainy/farmy maltiness.  I could live on those two beers alone.  This one even tops the Pikeland Kellerpils that I had on draught fresh, though not by a whole lot.  And lastly, taking in to account that this bottle sat warm for probably 7 or more months???  Youve got to be kidding me....And to think this isnt even one of the best Franconian lagers!
on tap at cafe abseits in bamberg. pretty pale shade of yellow. like a helles with a boost, some kiwifruit and mango in the aroma, decent grassy bitterness. nice stuff

Bottle (found in Boston).  YES - ever since leaving Germany, Im always on the hunt for a Landbier.  Nice hay/grassy malt aroma - smells like a German barn or field.  Hazy golden yellow color with moderate head.  Sour barley malt flavor.  A bit past its prime but still nice - would guess that this beer is great fresh but any Landbier found in the states is a treat.

Clear yellow body with lots of very small particles, short lived white head.  Smells like some kind of buttery cereal mixture on a wet sock.  Taste is very malty and grassy with peaches & apricots.  Grassy hops bring a short and weird bitterness that attacked my mouth roof without touching my tongue.  Im trying very hard to like real lagers but I feel like Ill be able to pronounce their names before I develop a real taste for them.

UPDATED: JAN 5, 2007 Cask (Bayrischer Anstich) at Akkurat, Stockholm.  Hazy golden, small head. Grassy nose. Very dry with firm, rounded mouthfeel and medium body. Light notes of butter and apples. Long bitter finish. Not as superb as some of the best beers from this brewer.
Draught @ Café Abseits, Bamberg. Hazy, yellow golden color with a creamy little head. Good grassy hop aroma. Toffee flavours balanced by good bitterness. Light body, dry mouthfeel.

Pours a hazy gold into a lager glass.  Fluffy white micro head leaves slight pockets of lacing as it slowly recedes.  Bread, hay and fresh barnyard notes.  Fizzy and full with a clean, lasting, (slightly) bitter hop finish.

Draught - Bruxellensis - A slightly hazy golden coloured beer with a reasonable white head.  The aroma is slightly buttery with some sharp hops.  The taste is clean, crisp, hoppy, lemony and sharp.  A tasty well brewed lager beer.

Draught at Bruxellensis,presented as Mönchsambacher Ungespundes Lager. Hazy, yellowish golden with a creamy little head. Good grassy hop aroma nicely intertwined with toffee. Toffee flavours balanced by good bitterness. Clean, yet highly enjoyable. Light body, dry mouthfeel. A very good lager- I wish they were all like this.

Draught at Café Abseits, Bamberg.  Clear golden with a rocky, creamy white head.  Aroma is hoppy and cellary, malty with a little funk, doughy.  Malty, bittersweet taste with cellar, chalk, hops, funk, even lite sprite-like citrusmmmMedium-to-full body, smooth but exciting, overall dry end with a little sweetness and chalk on ther soft palate.  Laces, touch of sourness.  Gentle, smooth, balanced, an absolutely fantastic Kellerbier.

Interesting appearance, unfiltered obviously as the style dictates.  A slightly grainey gold color, somewhat hazy, with a small white head.  Aroma is all bready, with a high amount of herbal hoppiness. Creamy and smooth on the palate, with not alot of carbonation.  Not heavy at all, but not very light either, just feels very good on the palate, once you get past the nasty appearance.  Great for summertime drinking

Really fine malt/hop nose, pretty hazy apricot, some floaties, and a large head. Beautiful malt flavour start, then the hops run in high and fast. Medium to full bodied, great mouthfeel. Terrific!

 Thanks mds!

.5 liter bottle- shaped like the schlenkerla style with a monk winking on the label.  Yellow an green label.  Lots and lots of wierd globules of yeast and protien on the bottom of the bottle, so be careful when pouring.  Yeast is good sometimes, but these globules are pretty nasty looking .  Poured very slowly to not disturb the sediment.  Slightly hazy medium gold with a nice fluffy stickly white head.  Aroma is nice fresh bready malts with a light herbal hop balance.  Reminds me of a really nice well made helles.  Flavor is lightly sweet, bready, doughy, lightly bitter in the end.  Tastes pretty fresh.  Ran me $4.50 for the half liter, but Im tempted to go back and get a couple more.  Great for summer drinking.

UPDATED: FEB 20, 2010 Cask at dba Brooklyn.  Very pale, cloudy pour with a thin white head.  The nose is nice and flinty with a bit of light minerally hoppiness and a bright, crisp, crackery palate.  A bit of light graininess with a very light, but clean yeastiness.  Excellent.

0.5 L flip-top bottle.  Bright gold colour with some suspended yeast.  Fresh bready aroma. Clean noble hop aroma as well.  Lightly yeasty with plenty of floral and citrusy hop notes throughout.  Flavour is very good, soft pale malt, creamy texture, low carbonation allowing the malts to shine without much interfering carbonic acidity.  Soft but insistent bitterness.  Floral and grassy with some faint earthiness.  Nice brew.
7 3 7 4 16

0.5L bottle.  Thanks Knut!  Light golden, clear, medium white head.  Good head retention.  Malty aroma with honey plus citrus/floral hops.  Nice malt flavor with distinct bitterness in the finish.  Slight dryness on tongue.  Great beer.

UPDATED: NOV 7, 2006 Impressions from the windowside:
-A veil of head surfs the golden sparkle.
-Virtuous citrus fruit freshen up the cereal and hay aplenty. Plantanes soon join the happy union.
-A pleasing herbal hop bitterness supports the ample maltiness.
-Yet another muscular yet kind-hearted body from the Franconian countryside, natural carbonation only helping.
-Great balance and coherence for this their house blond!
On tap at Café Abseits, Bamberg, and bottled back home.

UPDATED: OCT 23, 2009 Hazy gold. Huge, foamy, white head settles quickly and completely. Flavor and aroma of grainy malt, crisp hops, light fruit and floral notes, and bready yeast. Medium, balanced body. Easy drinking. Nice lager. [6,3,7,4,15=3.5. May 2006] Rerate 10/09: gravity pour at RedLight. Gold. White head. Crisp golden lager with herbal, grassy hops, a subtle malt and light colored fruit sweetness, and fresh grains. Clean, dry, mildly bitter finish. Excellent session lager. [current score].

05.16.06  500ml bottle I just purchased today.  I guess I shouldve read the few reviews here before opening my bottle and filling the glass with the golden-yellow goodness as its obviously agitated and completely filled with clumps of stuff, and thats just the first half of the bottle...oh, boy.  Lacing is left behind immediately by the lofty, rocky, fading white head.  Fantastic aroma is part pils and part saison, and its just what the doctor ordered as I spend half an hour just hoping some of the precipitates will precipitate, but they dont.  Instead, it appears as if the gunk is suspended in time, resting motionlessly in what must be a somewhat viscous brew, and it is.  For such lightly colored beer, I expected less body and am pleasantly surprised by its considerable heft and silky smooth feel.  Aromas and flavors smack of grassy hops, lemon and citrus, french bread, fresh, and lingering sweet/bitter finish.  With temperature, a welcoming aroma of wet wool socks emerges.  Absolutely delightful beer, and just in time for summer!

Bottle. Pours a light golden yellow colour and is pretty thick and hazy with a persistent large fluffy white head and tons of floaties. Biscuit in the aroma along with sharp grassy hops, hay, and cookies - completely pleasing to the senses IMO. Very soft biscuit flavour with nearly no carbonation. Flavourful grassy hops though maybe not as pronounced as others in the style. Creamy yeast mouthfeel. This is truly top notch!
Purchased at Merchants Fine Wines in Dearborn in April 2006.

Not a lot of experience with this style...Not much head at all-yellowish, unfiltered-looks a lot like a hefeweizen. Aroma has a little apple, earthy hops, and wheaty breadiness. Flavor is very dry with subtle yet pervasive earthy, bitter hoppage,  sweet grain, and bready maltiness. Overall, this is quite decent-I just wish I had more to compare it to.

Green yellow, off-white creamy head.
Full-bodied fruity malt base, very nicely balanced with a broad hop profile.

500 mL bottle, newly arrived in america.  unfiltered, unpasteurized - no kidding.  move the bottle even gently and you disturb a thick layer of snowflakey sediment.  in fact, i think you could look at this beer the wrong way and disturb the sediment.  hoppy floral grassy aroma, but its thankfully married to a beautiful presence of pale malt.  the flavor goes about the same way, with a slightly surprising bitterness immediately followed by clean malt and the tangy signature of lager yeast.  a real "farmhouse lager!"  $5 a bottle is not a bad deal at all.

Draught  Yellow-gold beer, slight haze, fast receding white head. Malty nose, pale malts, slight herbal aroma - and honey! Bitterish initial taste on top of pale matls with very little restsweetness. Medium bodied  thanks to quite some malt filling. Gets sweeter in the aftertaste and overall in the long end. If "lager" meant this, I would love the style, no doubt.

Tap, at Café Abseits in Bamberg. Jan 2005. Faintly hazy gold, moderate white head and gentle condition. Low sweet malt in the nose, hints of grain and sweet yeast in the mouth and a gentle but short grainy finish.

Tap in Steinkrug. Street Imbiss in Schlüsselfeld. Malty hoppy flavor , in fact a good deal of flavor. more than aroma. Firm bitter aftertaste. Middle of the road lager with enough quality to make drinking this beer a pleasure.
